admin_help_message:
<bold><gold>Admin Usage
<reset><green>To change the datapack name, go into the plugin folder called "<gold>CustomBlockGroups<green>", and go into the "<gold>config.yml<green>" file. 
Find the line with the key "<gold>datapackName<green>", and change the value to your datapack name. 
On your way you can also change the default world-scope, if you want. If you disable "<gold>globalAsDefault<green>", the default scope will be the current world of the player.
Then save the file and restart the server. The command permissions are: 
<light_purple>"cbg_create"<green>, <light_purple>"cbg_delete"<green>, <light_purple>"cbg_edit"<green>, <light_purple>"cbg_see"<green>, <light_purple>"cbg_help_admin"<green>.
By default see is for everyone and the rest are locked for Operators. 
Use a Permission Manager Plugin like "<gold>LuckPerms<green>" to change these.
general_help_message:
<bold><gold>General Usage
<reset><green>To use Custom Block Groups, you need to
create new group using the <light_purple>"cbg create"<green> command.
For the group to be usable, the server needs to 
reload/restart after a change.
If you for example want to use the groups in world edit, try out 
"<light_purple>//set ##${datapackName}:[group_name]<green>"
For more info how the current and 
registered state of a group is, 
use the <light_purple> "cbg info"<green>command, or the interface, 
which you can access under the <light_purple>"cbg interface"<green> command. 
To delete or modify an existing group, 
use the <light_purple>"cbg [edit/delete]"<green> command.
group_list_entry_modified: <green>The registered materials for the World <gold>"${worldName}<green>" are <gold>${old_materials}<green>", but there are modifications changing it too "<gold>${materials}<green>". <dark_purple>Reload<green>/<dark_purple>Restart <green>the Server to see changes!
group_list_entry_unregistered: <green>The materials for the World <gold>"${worldName}<green>" are: "<gold>${materials}<green>", but yet not registered. <dark_purple>Reload<green>/<dark_purple>Restart <green>the Server to use it!
group_list_modified: <green>The registered materials are "<gold>${old_materials}<green>", but there are modifications changing it too "<gold>${materials}<green>". <dark_purple>Reload<green>/<dark_purple>Restart <green>the Server to see changes!
group_list_multiple: <green>There are multiple versions of the group "<gold>${groupName}<green>" across the worlds.
group_list_unregistered: <green>The materials are: "<gold>${materials}<green>", but yet not registered. <dark_purple>Reload<green>/<dark_purple>Restart <green>the Server to use it!
group_not_found: <red>The group "<gold>${groupName}<red>" couldn't be found! (maybe your world-scope is wrong?)
interface_help_message:
<bold><gold>Interface Usage
<reset><green>To use the interface, you need to open it with the <light_purple>"cbg interface"<green> command. The Interface is a way to see & modify existing groups. 
From then on you can change your scope, your grouping-setting or just directly click on a group.
From then on, you can modify it using the Edit Items button, 
and just directly change the inventory. Remember to save!
invalid_character_in_name: <red>The character "<gold>${char}<red>" is not allowed in the name.</red>
name_ends_with_dot: <red>The name "<gold>${name}<red>" is not allowed because it ends with a dot.<ed>
reserved_name_not_allowed: <red>The name "<gold>${name}<red>" is not allowed because it is a reserved name.
use_air_editing: <yellow>(you cannot change this in edit mode)
use_air_last: <yellow>(you cannot turn off air if it's the last material)
use_air_old: <yellow>(Cannot change, this is the old version)
use_air_permissionless: <yellow>(You don't have the permission to change this group)
world_already_used: <red>The world "<gold>${worldName}<red>" was called twice or higher!
world_help_message:
<bold><gold>World Usage
<reset><green>After typing <light_purple>"cbg<green>", enter a "<gold>-<green>", to access the world modifier. 
Either type global / current, or a particular world name. 
You can chain multiple words by seperating them with a "<gold>,<green>". 
This will change the scope of the next commands you enter.
